metadata.title: CVE-2021-27216 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 has Execution with Unnecessary Privileges. Byleveraging a delete_pid_file race condition, a local user can deletearbitrary files as root. This involves the -oP and -oPX options.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27216` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
exim4-base - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
exim4-config - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
exim4-daemon-light - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
eximon4 - 4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.86.2-2ubuntu2.6+esm1').
